title: Uqora Side Effects and Product Info | Uqora
description: Although there are no known side effects for Uqora's ingredients, here we provide more information on considerations when taking Uqora's products.
cleaned_text: safe to take alongside birth control unless otherwise instructed by your doctor. You can take Defend and Promote, even if you are on antibiotics (unless otherwise instructed by your doctor). We recommend getting started right away! Flush contains potassium and potassium citrate. It can be important to monitor intake of these when taking the following antibiotics: Sulfamethoxazole/trimethoprim, ciprofloxacin, and levofloxacin. If you're taking any of those antibiotics, you should not drink Flush until you're finished with your antibiotic treatment. Uqora Control contains curcumin, which has a possible contraindication with the blood thinner warfarin. If you take warfarin or similar blood thinners, we recommend speaking with your physician before taking Uqora Control.
